title: Channel Islands National Park: 2016 Archived Lecture Videos
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     From Shore to Sea Lectures     2016 Archived Lecture Videos                  2016 "From Shore to Sea" Archived Lecture Videos        Please note that the 2016 "From Shore to Sea" lecture series was extended to a monthly series in honor of the National Park Service Centennial.             Channel Islands National Park: The Past, Present, and Future   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 9 minutes, 30 seconds  The 2016 "From Shore to Sea" lecture series was extended to a monthly series in honor of the National Park Service Centennial. The series opened with a talk by Gary Davis, former NPS Chief Ocean Scientist, on the past, present, and future of Channel Islands National Park, our nation's 40th national park.               Mating Behaviors of Fish at the Channel Islands   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts Dr. Milton Love, a research biologist at the University of California, Santa Barbara Marine Science Institute, discussed the wide range of behaviors that mating fish exhibit during the February From Shore to Sea lecture.               A Deep History of California’s Northern Channel Islands: Part 1   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 7 minutes, 29 seconds  Dr. Jon M. Erlandson, archaeologist and professor at the University of Oregon, discussed over 13,000 years of archaeological evidence that provides a glimpse into how humans have adapted to life on the Channel Islands.               A Deep History of California’s Northern Channel Islands Part 2   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 46 seconds  Dr. Jon M. Erlandson, archaeologist and professor at the University of Oregon, discussed over 13,000 years of archaeological evidence that provides a glimpse into how humans have adapted to life on the Channel Islands.               Anacapa and the American Sublime   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:49 minutes, 21 seconds  Anna Guasco discussed changes in the ways Anacapa Island has been perceived and represented throughout history during the April From Shore to Sea lecture.               Islands Apart: A Year on the Edge of Civilization   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:55 minutes, 28 seconds  Local author Ken McAlpine compared the experience of solitude on the Channel Islands to the bustle of life on the mainland as he shared excerpts from his book, Islands Apart: A Year on the Edge of Civilization, during the May From Shore to Sea lecture.                Exploring the Channel Islands by Kayak   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 44 seconds  Local freelance writer and photographer Chuck Graham described his favorite kayaking trips during the June From Shore to Sea lecture. NOTE: The information presented in this lecture is by a professional and is not the recommended procedures for kayaking within the park.                Restoring Bird Habitat on the Channel Islands    Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 4 minutes, 13 seconds  U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service wildlife biologist Annie Little described the work that has been done since 2002 to help populations of birds on the Channel Islands recover from loss of habitat and the adverse effects of the pesticide DDT, during the July From Shore to Sea lecture
